issue.title: Add option to turn off zoom-on-model on double click

content.raw:
We shouldn't turn this off. The user can reset their view using the view menu.

In the question linked above, the user was randomly clicking to try things. We just need to improve our documentation, maybe with an in-gui help.

issue.title: Add option to turn off zoom-on-model on double click

content.raw:
Actually there have been times when I wanted to turn this off as well. When trying to inspect some model from a specific angle, I carefully adjust the view. Then I double-click something by mistake and suddenly the view is zoomed in a lot and I get disoriented. Resetting the view means I have to adjust it all over again.

This happens quite often while using in the model editor, where you might try double-clicking a joint hotspot, but it's so easy to miss because it is very small, and you end up zooming in on whatever is behind it.

Maybe we could just turn this behavior off when editing a model?
